oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Card featuring joke text with message from Ammons on the back

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Card from Ammons featuring graphic and the text "The Viet Cong are very tricky with booby traps so open this card carefully. On the reverse, Ammons describes weather and patrols around Vung Chua. He describes time he spent teaching two new men about standing guard duty, and says he is one of only three people in this post to have any real "bush" or combat duties.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher D. Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, in 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970.
